intro: Ageratum rugosum, commonly known as rough ageratum, is an annual flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, pink to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often used in gardens for its ornamental value. Ageratum rugosum is also valued for its ability to attract beneficial insects like ladybugs and parasitic wasps.
